===Etymology===
{{unk.|lang=ja|sort=がっこ}}. Probably coined in Japan of {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=がっこ}}-derived elements {{m|ja|楽|tr=gaku||music}} + {{m|ja|戸|tr=ko||house; school}}.

{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|がっこ}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|がっこ|hhira=がくこ}}

# in the [[w:Nara period|Nara period]], a kind of private-sector school or house of {{m|ja|雅楽|tr=gagaku||court music}} unaffiliated directly with the official court ''gagaku'' office
# in ancient [[China]], an [[entertainer]] performing song, dance, and music, appointed to the imperial court, and originally often chosen from among the women of [[convict]]s' families
